newsitem.title: HUNGARY: MOTOR RACING-SCHUMACHER TAKES POLE FOR HUNGARIAN GRAND PRIX.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-SCHUMACHER TAKES POLE FOR HUNGARIAN GRAND PRIX.

text.p: - Double world champion Michael Schumacher of Germany secured the 17th pole position of his career on Saturday when he topped the times in qualifying for Sunday's Hungarian Grand Prix.

The 28-year-old German clocked a best time of one minute and 14.672 seconds in his Ferrari to claim the prime grid position for the third time this year and seventh since he joined Ferrari last season.

The world championship leader, who holds a 10-point advantage over nearest rival Jacques Villeneuve of Canada in the title race, finished 0.187 seconds ahead of Villeneuve in his Renault-backed Williams and four-tenths of a second clear of third-placed Briton Damon Hill.
World champion Hill, in his Yamaha-powered Arrows, clocked his best lap in the dying seconds of the session to stun most observers and finish just ahead of Finn Mika Hakkinen in a McLaren.
Briton Eddie Irvine in a Ferrari was fifth fastest and will share the third row of the grid with German Heinz-Harald Frentzen in the second Williams.

Hill's performance came after he was 11th quickest in morning practice and proved that he was the arch-exponent at using his competitive Bridgestone tyres to their greatest advantage since he was the only non-Goodyear-tyred driver to qualify in the top 10.
